section.p: The configsettings.properties file located in <install_pack_dir>/databases/app_db contains the configuration settings for APP.

section.title: APP_BASE_URL
section.p: The URL used to access APP.

section.title: APP_TIMER_INTERVAL
section.p: The interval (in milliseconds) at which APP polls the status of instances. If you increase the value, provisioning takes longer. If you decrease it, more load is put on the system. We strongly recommend that you do not set a value of more than 180000 milliseconds (3 minutes), although the maximum value is much higher (922337203685477580).
If you do not specify this setting at all, the default value used is 15000.

section.title: APP_TIMER_REFRESH_SUBSCRIPTIONS
section.p: The interval (in milliseconds) at which APP polls the status of instances and updates respective subscription parameters in the bssapp database, for example the number of virtual machines book with a subscription, and the number of users assigned to the subscriptions.
If you do not specify this setting, the default value used is 86400000 (once a day).

section.title: APP_MAIL_RESOURCE
section.p: The JNDI name of the GlassFish mail resource used to send emails.
The resource mail/APPMail is created during setup with the parameters defined in the glassfish.properties file. This setting needs to be changed only if you want to use a different mail resource.

section.title: APP_ADMIN_MAIL_ADDRESS
section.p: The email address to which email notifications are sent.

refbody.section:
APP_KEY_PATHThe path to the file containing the key required for encryption and decryption of service parameters with data type PWD or custom attributes marked for encryption.
Upon the start of APP, it is checked whether a key file exists in the location specified in this setting. If this not the case, the key file is automatically generated and stored in the location specified here. If nothing is specified, the file will be generated into the default location and named key.Default:
<GLASSFISH_HOME>/glassfish/domains/app-domain/config
Be aware that the key file must not be deleted. Otherwise, encryption and decryption is no longer possible. It is recommended to create a backup of this file once generated.

section.title: APP_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD
section.p: The password required to access the keystore of the domain used for APP in the application server.

section.title: APP_TRUSTSTORE
section.p: The path and file name of the truststore of the application server domain used for APP. The certificate of is stored in this truststore.

section.title: APP_TRUSTSTORE_BSS_ALIAS
section.p: The alias of the certificate of as stored in the truststore of the application server domain used for APP.

section.title: APP_TRUSTSTORE_PASSWORD
section.p: The password required to access the truststore of the application server domain used for APP.

refbody.section:
BSS_AUTH_MODE
BSS_AUTH_MODE=INTERNAL
Specifies whether is used for user authentication or whether it acts as a SAML service provider and allows for single sign-on. The setting must be identical to the AUTH_MODE setting in .Possible values: INTERNAL ( user authentication is used) or SAML_SP ( acts as a SAML service provider).
Contact the platform operator for details on which value to set.

section.title: BSS_USER_KEY
section.p: The user key for accessing .
Replace <userKey> with the user key which you receive with the confirmation email for your user account.

The user specified here must have the administrator role for your organization in . The user account is used for carrying out actions on behalf of APP in . In addition, the user is allowed to register service controllers in APP.

section.title: BSS_USER_ID
section.p: The identifier of the user specified in BSS_USER_KEY for accessing .
Replace <userId> with the user ID.

section.title: BSS_USER_PWD
section.p: The password of the user specified in BSS_USER_KEY for accessing .
Replace <password> with the plain text password. The password is encrypted when it is stored in the database.

section.title: BSS_WEBSERVICE_URL
section.p: Mandatory when BSS_AUTH_MODE is set to INTERNAL and basic authentication is used. The endpoint of the Web services to be used. The {SERVICE} placeholder must not be replaced.

section.title: BSS_WEBSERVICE_WSDL_URL
section.p: Mandatory when BSS_AUTH_MODE is set to INTERNAL and basic authentication is used. The URL specifying the version of the Web services to be used. The {SERVICE} placeholder must not be replaced.

section.title: BSS_STS_WEBSERVICE_URL
section.p: Mandatory when BSS_AUTH_MODE is set to SAML_SP and security token based authentication is used. The endpoint of the Web services to be used. The {SERVICE} placeholder must not be replaced.

section.title: BSS_STS_WEBSERVICE_WSDL_URL
section.p: Mandatory when BSS_AUTH_MODE is set to SAML_SP. The URL specifying the version of the Web services to be used. The {SERVICE} placeholder must not be replaced.
